samples.context: The soccer coach knows that players who train hard will improve their skills. Also, players who study tactics will understand the game better. However, players have limited energy and time. James can either train hard or not understand the game better.
samples.question: Does this entail that James, a soccer player, either improves his skills or does not study tactics?

samples.context: In a farm, cows that eat nutritious feed produce more milk. Also, cows that are vaccinated remain healthy. However, due to limited resources, the farmer must choose between feed and vaccines for the cows. The cows cannot have both nutritious feed and vaccines regularly. The cows can either eat nutritious feed or not remain healthy.
samples.question: Does this mean that the cows on the farm either produce more milk or are not vaccinated?

samples.context: Jen is a student who studies hard for exams and gets good grades. She also networks and socializes a lot which leads to many job opportunities after graduation. However, Jen struggles to balance studying and socializing. She can either study hard or miss out on job opportunities.
samples.question: Does this mean Jen either gets good grades or does not network and socialize?

samples.context: The student knows if he studies more, he will get high marks on the test. And if he gets enough sleep, his mind will be sharp. But he has so much material to review that he must sacrifice sleep. He can either study thoroughly or not keep his mind sharp.
samples.question: Does this lead to the conclusion that the student will either get high marks or does not get enough sleep?

samples.context: In a software company, developers who are given clear specifications can deliver projects on time. Also, developers who receive training improve their skills. However, the management has limited time for providing specifications and training. The developers cannot have abundant specifications and training together. Developers can either receive clear specifications or not improve their skills.
samples.question: Does this mean that developers in the software company either deliver projects on time or do not receive training?

samples.context: Jill is a student who studies hard for exams and usually gets good grades. Her friend Amy is creative and gets praise from teachers for her imagination. But Jill doesn't have time to be very creative since she is busy studying. She can either study hard or not get praised for creativity.
samples.question: Does this mean that Jill, who is busy studying for exams, either gets good grades or does not show creativity?

samples.context: The farmer realizes that if he plants his crops earlier, they will mature faster. And if he waters them sufficiently, the crops will grow bigger. However, water is scarce this season so he can't do both. The farmer can plant the crops early or the crops do not grow bigger.
samples.question: Does this entail that the farmer's crops either mature faster or the farmer does not water the crops sufficiently,?

samples.context: The local bakery has a policy that if an employee shows up early they get a promotion. Also, if an employee invents a new recipe they get a bonus. However, the employees struggle to do both consistently. Jane can either show up early or not get a bonus.
samples.question: Does this entail that Jane, an employee at the bakery, either gets a promotion or does not invent a new recipe?

samples.context: The factory has state-of-the-art equipment to efficiently mass produce products. They also rigorously test products to ensure high quality. However, using outdated equipment would allow increased production, while reducing testing would cut costs. The factory can either uses state-of-the-art equipment or not ensure high quality.
samples.question: Does this entail the factory either does mass produce efficiently or does not rigorously test products?

samples.context: At an office, employees who arrive early are able to start work immediately. Also, employees who are meticulous produce high-quality work. However, some employees focus on being punctual while others obsess over details. They cannot excel in both arriving early and attention to detail. Employees can either arrive early or not produce high-quality work.
samples.question: Does this mean that employees at the office either start work immediately or are not meticulous?
